Claim: There is no space in the hospitals in Italy because people are crowding outside.
Explaination: The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is no space in the hospitals in Italy because people are crowding outside.

Explanation:The claim with the pictures is false. While these photos are both real and recent, they are actually from Croatia’s capital Zagreb, which was rocked by a powerful earthquake on 22 March.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/photos-from-aftermath-of-earthquake-croatia-shared-as-effect-of-coronavirus-in-italy-fact-check

Claim: An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy.
Explaination: A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image of coffins showing the victims of COVID-19 in Italy.

Explanation:A Facebook post with an image claiming to show the victims of COVID-19 in Italy uses a photo of the coffins of African immigrants who drowned off the coast near Lampedusa in 2013.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-image-of-coffins-in-italy-was-taken-in-2013-not-2020-190ad6db1d81?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Coronavirus outbreak attributed to an advisory from India’s Health Ministry.
Explaination: The viral notification post on coronavirus outbreak is falsely attributed to Health Ministry.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus outbreak attributed to an advisory from India’s Health Ministry.

Explanation:The viral notification post on coronavirus outbreak is falsely attributed to Health Ministry.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-fake-post-on-coronavirus-outbreak-attributed-to-health-ministry-advisory-getting-viral/
ann25_remarks: Has a bit of overlap with conspiracy theories too

Claim: Photo posts claim a person is committing suicide by jumping from a building in Italy, a doctor couple in an Italian hospital a few hours before their death and chaos in an Italian hospital amid COVID-19.
Explaination: The first image is from Spain where a woman committed suicide in December 2019, The second image is of a couple at the Barcelona airport and the third image is from recent earthquake in Croatia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo posts claim a person is committing suicide by jumping from a building in Italy, a doctor couple in an Italian hospital a few hours before their death and chaos in an Italian hospital amid COVID-19.

Explanation:The first image is from Spain where a woman committed suicide in December 2019, The second image is of a couple at the Barcelona airport and the third image is from recent earthquake in Croatia.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/26/fact-check-series-of-old-and-unrelated-images-shared-as-current-situation-in-italy-related-with-covid19/

Claim: The Disaster Management Act 2005 is going to be implemented in India; no citizen is allowed to post any update or share any forward related to COVID-19.
Explaination: There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the COVID-19 situation, as long as it is not false information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Disaster Management Act 2005 is going to be implemented in India; no citizen is allowed to post any update or share any forward related to COVID-19.

Explanation:There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the COVID-19 situation, as long as it is not false information.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/02/disaster-management-act-does-not-restrict-citizens-to-share-post-on-covid-19/

Claim: Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states.
Explaination: Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Ministry of Health and Family Welfare issued an office memorandum declaring compulsory holiday in four Indian states.

Explanation:Ministry of Health India has denied any such notification.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/13/moh-issued-an-office-memo-claiming-compulsory-holiday-in-4-states-due-to-covid-19/

Claim: As per the video, Bollywood actor Aamir Khan donated 250 crore to fight aganist COVID-19.
Explaination: The video is six years old.
Label: False
html:
Claim: As per the video, Bollywood actor Aamir Khan donated 250 crore to fight aganist COVID-19.

Explanation:The video is six years old.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-coronavirus-lockdown-bollywood-actor-aamir-khan-donate-250-crore-rupees-fake-news-1-1175639.html

Claim: A list of 10 claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.
Explaination: Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A list of 10 claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.

Explanation:Most of the claims in the message are false and many are misleading. Drinking warm water will not protect you from getting the coronavirus, for example, and there is no evidence that the virus is killed by a temperature of 26/27 degrees either.

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-coronavirus-whatsapp-5059709-Mar2020/

Claim: In Japan, Okinawa Prefecture Governor Tamaki Denny was seen Kachashi dancing with the mayor of Nanjo City. It was reported that “the governor and the mayor danced while the people were terrified about the new coronavirus infection.”
Explaination: It is true that Governor Tamaki danced Kachashi with Mayor Zukeran in January 25. But this is before a cruise ship anchored in Naha.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In Japan, Okinawa Prefecture Governor Tamaki Denny was seen Kachashi dancing with the mayor of Nanjo City. It was reported that “the governor and the mayor danced while the people were terrified about the new coronavirus infection.”

Explanation:It is true that Governor Tamaki danced Kachashi with Mayor Zukeran in January 25. But this is before a cruise ship anchored in Naha.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/kensukeseya/okinawa-korona-1

Claim: Holding your breath can test for COVID-19.
Explaination: WHO and other health experts said there is no evidence to support this claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Holding your breath can test for COVID-19.

Explanation:WHO and other health experts said there is no evidence to support this claim.

https://factcheck.afp.com/world-health-organization-refutes-viral-claims-holding-your-breath-can-test-covid-19
ann25_remarks: This is about testing, but  could also be about authority.

Claim: Chinese spies stole the coronavirus from a Canadian lab.
Explaination: Mix up with an investigation of Chinese scientist in Canada in 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese spies stole the coronavirus from a Canadian lab.

Explanation:Mix up with an investigation of Chinese scientist in Canada in 2019.

https://factcheck.afp.com/chinese-spies-did-not-steal-deadly-coronavirus-canada

Claim: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from the coronavirus in Italy.
Explaination: Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows dozens of wooden coffins of people dead from the coronavirus in Italy.

Explanation:Photo is of the coffins of African migrants who drowned off Italian island in 2013.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/photo-of-migrants-drowned-in-2013-not-italys-coronavirus-victims/

Claim: Actor Tom Hanks died due to coronavirus.
Explaination: This is a hoax. Tom hanks and his wife is recovering from coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Actor Tom Hanks died due to coronavirus.

Explanation:This is a hoax. Tom hanks and his wife is recovering from coronavirus.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-actor-tom-hanks-taken-ill-covid-19-but-this-is-a-hoax-1655821-2020-03-15

Claim: Says The New York Times exposed the “real reason behind coronavirus hype: Crash the market to harm Trump’s re-election chances.”
Explaination: There's no evidence the coronavirus was manufactured. The New York Times story referenced was an analysis of how current events may influence the election.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Says The New York Times exposed the “real reason behind coronavirus hype: Crash the market to harm Trump’s re-election chances.”

Explanation:There's no evidence the coronavirus was manufactured. The New York Times story referenced was an analysis of how current events may influence the election.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/19/blog-posting/blog-pushes-conspiracy-coronavirus-was-invented-hu/

Claim: WHO has said, do not eat cabbage as it will increase the chance of coronavirus infection.
Explaination: WHO has not said anything that shows cabbage has any relation to coronavirus.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: WHO has said, do not eat cabbage as it will increase the chance of coronavirus infection.

Explanation:WHO has not said anything that shows cabbage has any relation to coronavirus.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-corona-virus-is-not-related-to-eating-cabbage-1-1173982.html

Claim: Having a beard increases your chances of getting coronavirus.
Explaination: The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards, a 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Having a beard increases your chances of getting coronavirus.

Explanation:The CDC never told anyone to shave their beards, a 2017 graphic circulating the web from the CDC was put out to show the effectiveness of masks with facial hair. The work-place graphic is unrelated to the current coronavirus.

https://youtu.be/2CBGeQmJuow
ann25_remarks: Could also be public authority because of CDC mention

Claim: The Chinese prime minister visited a mosque to gain protection for coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is of the then Malaysian Prime minister in 2015 visiting a mosque in Beijing.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The Chinese prime minister visited a mosque to gain protection for coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is of the then Malaysian Prime minister in 2015 visiting a mosque in Beijing.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/no-the-chinese-pm-did-not-visit-a-mosque-to-protect-himself-from-coronavirus-6763

Claim: People sneezing purposefully to spread coronavirus at Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi.
Explaination: The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: People sneezing purposefully to spread coronavirus at Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi.

Explanation:The video has been available on the internet since long. It has no connection to coronavirus.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/video-prayers-shared-people-sneezing-spread-coronavirus-nizamuddin-1662287-2020-04-01
ann25_remarks: Torn between this option and none of the above

Claim: People will not be allowed to organize a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the state will take care of the disposal of the body.
Explaination: The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People will not be allowed to organize a funeral for any family members who die of COVID-19. Instead, the state will take care of the disposal of the body.

Explanation:The rules around funerals have changed as gatherings are currently not allowed, but families are still allowed to look after funeral services for their loved ones without the involvement of the State.

https://jrnl.ie/5057356

Claim: 5G exposure/radiation pollution compromises the structure and function of hemoglobin in cells and worsens COVID-19 pandemic.
Explaination: Wireless communications use electromagnetic waves to transfer data. Electromagnetic waves carry energy that is proportional to their frequency and can interact with biological tissues. However, the energy level and the penetration depth of the type of waves used for 5G do not allow them to alter the structure and function of important biological macromolecules such as hemoglobin. In addition, there is no correlation between the very limited 5G coverage in the world and the progression of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Label: Incorrect
html:
Claim: 5G exposure/radiation pollution compromises the structure and function of hemoglobin in cells and worsens COVID-19 pandemic.

Explanation:Wireless communications use electromagnetic waves to transfer data. Electromagnetic waves carry energy that is proportional to their frequency and can interact with biological tissues. However, the energy level and the penetration depth of the type of waves used for 5G do not allow them to alter the structure and function of important biological macromolecules such as hemoglobin. In addition, there is no correlation between the very limited 5G coverage in the world and the progression of the COVID-19 pandemic.

https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/conspiracy-theorists-claim-that-5g-increases-vulnerability-to-covid-19-with-baseless-theory-that-it-affects-hemoglobin/

Claim: Israeli scientists at the MIGAL Research Institute have developed a vaccine for COVID-19.
Explaination: Researchers at the MIGAL Institute in Israel have announced a breakthrough in research into the novel coronavirus, but they have not developed a vaccine as claimed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Israeli scientists at the MIGAL Research Institute have developed a vaccine for COVID-19.

Explanation:Researchers at the MIGAL Institute in Israel have announced a breakthrough in research into the novel coronavirus, but they have not developed a vaccine as claimed.

https://pesacheck.org/false-there-is-currently-no-vaccine-against-covid-19-d2ef50cc1dff

Claim: Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times by Australian social media users claim people with pre-existing respiratory conditions will be given a “rescue pack” of medication from their general practitioners during the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumour as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Multiple Facebook and Twitter posts shared thousands of times by Australian social media users claim people with pre-existing respiratory conditions will be given a “rescue pack” of medication from their general practitioners during the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; Australia’s Department of Health dismissed the rumour as “misinformation”, adding that patients will not receive “rescue packs” from their doctors unless previously prescribed.

https://factcheck.afp.com/australian-health-authorities-dismiss-hoax-claim-about-rescue-packs-vulnerable-patients
ann25_remarks: Has overlap with treatments, but this still sounds more like public authority

Claim: A Shaheen Bagh protest in India was claimed to have coronavirus.
Explaination: BOOM contacted hospitals in Delhi and confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protest had tested positive for COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Shaheen Bagh protest in India was claimed to have coronavirus.

Explanation:BOOM contacted hospitals in Delhi and confirmed that no Shaheen Bagh protest had tested positive for COVID-19.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/fake-messages-claim-shaheen-bagh-protester-tested-positive-for-coronavirus-7140

Claim: The Health Authority confirmed 3 cases of the 2019 coronavirus in the country.
Explaination: There were no confirmed cases at that time.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Health Authority confirmed 3 cases of the 2019 coronavirus in the country.

Explanation:There were no confirmed cases at that time.

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/coronavirus-ecuador-ministerio-caso-pandemia/

Claim: “Coronavirus — 22. Clintons — 39.”
Explaination: Conspiracies linking the Clintons to various deaths are longstanding and unsubstantiated. We've debunked a number of them. The novel coronavirus has killed thousands globally.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Coronavirus — 22. Clintons — 39.”

Explanation:Conspiracies linking the Clintons to various deaths are longstanding and unsubstantiated. We've debunked a number of them. The novel coronavirus has killed thousands globally.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/facebook-posts/no-clintons-arent-responsible-more-deaths-coronavi/
